nodes.text: Zoochberries were a berry used in a variety of dishes, including cobblers, cream, dumplings, juice, pie, and topping. Dishes that used them were edible by Besalisks, Humans, Hutts, and Wookiees. The Besalisk Dexter Jettster consumed zoochberries daily after discovering them, and he later used them in several dishes at his diner on the planet Coruscant. Jettster also served zoochberries as a side for multiple breakfast meals. Other dishes that used zoochberries were eaten throughout the Trioculus affair of 5 ABY. Multiple idioms also involved the berries and the dishes that used them.

Zoochberries were a type of berry used in dishes throughout the galaxy, including deserts. The dishes included zoochberry pie, zoochberry cobbler, zoochberry cream, zoochberry dumpling, zoochberry juice, and zoochberry topping. Dishes using the berries were edible by Besalisks, Humans, Hutts, and Wookiees.

The Besalisk Dexter Jettster encountered zoochberries as a trader of furbogs on the Corellian Run hyperlane, where he came into possession of more zoochberries than he could handle. According to Jettster, one furbog was worth ten times its weight in zoochberries, and he found himself consuming the berries almost daily, including in a cobbler. Jettster later opened an eatery named Dex's Diner on the planet Coruscant, where he recounted his discovery of zoochberries in its menu. The diner served zoochberry cobblers as a dessert for 2.7 credits, charging a further three credits to be served with a scoop of denta bean ice cream. Jettster also offered a choice of zoochberries or ettel nuts as a side for the breakfast meals Panna cake and Iktotch toast for one extra credit, and served Neuvian sundaes with a choice of Trammistan chocolate or zoochberry topping. The Diner operated until it was destroyed during the first two years of the Galactic Empire's reign, which began in 19 BBY.

Zoochberries continued to be used in dishes throughout the galaxy during the Trioculus affair of 5 ABY. Zoochberry cream was served alongside Whaladon meat in a meeting of the Central Committee of Grand Moffs on Kessel. The newly declared Emperor Trioculus knocked over a serving flask of zoochberry cream during the meeting. Some time afterward, the Human Luke Skywalker visited his friend Han Solo at his new sky house on the planet Bespin, where Solo's Wookiee companion Chewbacca used his newfound cooking skills to prepare zoochberry pie. Skywalker said it was the best zoochberry pie he had ever tasted.

Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina on the planet Tatooine served zoochberry juice. There, the Barabel Tibor suggested that the Hutt Zorba Desilijic Tiure consume a glass of the juice while calming down. Later, Solo hosted a housewarming party at his sky house where he ensured that his guest's zoochberry juice glasses were full in his capacity as host, as there was a significant quantity available. When Solo and his romantic partner, Leia Organa, traveled to Hologram Fun World to be married, they met their friend Lando Calrissian there, who poured glasses of zoochberry juice for each of them. When the couple realized that they needed their birth certificates, which were unavailable, Calrissian expressed through an idiom that getting new copies at the Document Bureau would be as simple as zoochberry pie.

Later, Organa was captured by Zorba and the Imperial Moffs to be forcibly married to Trioculus. While launching a rescue attempt on the Moffship, Solo quipped that finding Organa could turn out like looking for a micro-chip in a field of zoochberries. Zorba later traveled to Scardia Station, home of the Prophets of the Dark Side, who hosted a large banquet for the Hutt's arrival, which included zoochberry dumplings. Zorba consumed them hastily, spilling some of the dumplings on High Prophet Jedgar's robe.
Zoochberries were first mentioned in their cream dish form in the 1992 junior novel The Glove of Darth Vader, written by Paul and Hollace Davids.
